definition: to use/to exert
to make/to cause/to enable/to use/to employ/to send/to instruct sb to do sth/envoy/messenger

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: He put forth all his strength and uprooted the tree.
sentences.chinese: 他使出全部的力气，把树拔了起来。

sentences.english: So basically, the bow doesn't put-out as much energy as you put-in.
sentences.chinese: 所以基本上，船首不会使出更多能源作为你的。

sentences.english: He is a cheeper apparently, I make him purposely happy, exert all over skill.
sentences.chinese: 他明显是个雏，我有心让他快乐，使出了浑身解数。

sentences.english: But I expect a full strenght team to play against the Hammers.
sentences.chinese: 但是我期待我们队能够使出全力去击败斧头帮。

sentences.english: Now China will pull out all the stops to make sure Modiji doesn't become PM.
sentences.chinese: 现在中国会使出所有招数以确保穆迪当不成总理。

sentences.english: Lucy: If you're ever in an argument, you can always trump with a dead mother.
sentences.chinese: 如果相持不下就使出你死老妈子的绝招。

sentences.english: Putting forth a great effort,he uprooted the tree.
sentences.chinese: 他使出了很大的劲，把那棵树连根拔起。

sentences.english: She swung the hammer at his head with all her might.
sentences.chinese: 她使出全身力气抡起榔头砸向他的脑袋。

sentences.english: A man's whole strength is required to successfully carry out these singular ascents .
sentences.chinese: 他得使出全身力气才能巧妙地自个儿直升上去。

sentences.english: How are we to know what sort of a hanky-panky trick you're up to?
sentences.chinese: 我们怎知道你会使出怎样的卑劣手段。

sentences.english: He hit it with his blood mushed hands driving a good harpoon with all his strength.
sentences.chinese: 他使出全身的力气，用糊着鲜血的双手，把一支好。

sentences.english: Town Mouse and Country Mouse ran away as fast as they could.
sentences.chinese: 城里老鼠和乡下老鼠都使出了吃奶的劲拼命逃着。

sentences.english: Both of the wrestlers tried to tumble the adversary with all their strength.
sentences.chinese: 双方摔跤运动员都使出了全身气力想把对手摔倒。

sentences.english: When he threatened to kill Pentangeli's family members Godfather was hitting the soft underbelly.
sentences.chinese: 教父使出围魏救赵之计，威胁杀害老潘的家人来解危。

sentences.english: They make seductive women to corrupt GetWord("corrupt"); the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 他们对敌人使出了美人计。

sentences.english: It was a wake-up call for Milan who began to take the game seriously and utilise all their assets.
sentences.chinese: 米兰方才如梦初醒，认真对待比赛，使出浑身解数。

definition: move (in chess, on stage, in martial arts)/gambit/trick/scheme/movement/same as 著數|着数[zhao1 shu4]
to use fully/to put to use
unique skill/unexpected tricky move (as a last resort)/masterstroke/finishing blow
to give it your all/to go at it with all you've got/to throw your whole weight behind it/also pr. [hun2 shen1 jie3 shu4]
consummate skill/supreme feat/tour-de-force/stunt
style/manner
to exhaust/to use up completely
to make a move (in martial arts or figuratively)
to brandish (a figurative weapon, i.e. some measure intended to deal with the situation)/to resort to (some tactic)
(fig.) trump card
talent/ability/capability/martial arts technique/Taiwan pr. [jie3 shu4]
to resist/to ward off/to hold one's own/to receive guests
to show results/effective
to stay out of (hot water, trouble, awkward situation etc)/to avoid (sb)
to dodge/to evade
strength/CL:把[ba3]
